instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> Missing
threads.message:
I have green Light, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> but i dont get <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>

PPBUS - 12.62V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is Present
<SIGNAL>PM_SUS_EN</SIGNAL> is Present
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> is Present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> Missing
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>?
Original 85W charger?
Also check RTC signals...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> Missing
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> - Is present
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> - No Present and Short to ground is 1.600MΩ
RTC - I can't check
Original Charge

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> Missing
threads.message:
"Short to ground is 1.600MΩ"
I can't understand this; is short, or not?

"RTC - I can't check"
Why???
I wrote SIGNALS; so i didn't reffer to an oscillation; in case you don't have o-scope.
There are 4 (FOUR) RTC signals (voltage levels) to check.

Missing <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> points more to SMC side than PCH, but check these signals anyway...
If <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> is OK, PCH does something at least.

Does the board starts with both charger and battery connected?
Check if SMC receives 32KHz in S5, with charger.
Original charger, but is 85W???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> Missing
